title: SBP reserves fall $15m - Business - DAWN.COM
content:
KARACHI: The foreign exchange reserves of the State Bank of Pakistan (SBP) decreased by $15 million to $11.69bn during the week ended on Jan 3, reported the central bank on Thursday.

The SBP reserves have been declining for the last three weeks.

The countryâ€™s total reserves were $16.377bn, including $4.682bn held by commercial banks.

Published in Dawn, January 10th, 2025
